result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesus R Ladwig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, surcharges, DNA surcharge, and restitution.  Bail to apply.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of, during Extended supervison.  Any amount reamining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised:   as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that his voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus R Ladwig

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original transcript (18 pages) commencing SENTENCING HEARING 09/04/2014. Received and Filed.
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 09/25/14. AR
for hearing scheduled 9/4/2014 in branch 38
14A 029457/reversed  to correct

Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is in custody on new charges for Waukesha County.  $2500.00 cash bail is posted on this case.
State's motion for HIV testing of defendant is granted by the Court.  ORDER for HIV testing is signed and filed.
Defendant stipulates to payment of restitution in the amount of $817.79 to Aurora Health Care.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 5 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 24 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 30 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Court orders restitution in the amount of $817.79 payable to Aurora Health Care.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED TO RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS IMPOSED any outstanding amount to be paid during extended supervision. Civil judgment to be entered if unpaid.
-Defendant to participate in recommended programming.
-Defendant to have no contact with victim, MM.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

As to amended Count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of no contest.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged of the amended charge and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility and sex offender registry requirements.   All conditions of bail remain.

Court ordered jury trial and final pre-trial vacated.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Miriam S. Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 amended to 3rd Degree sexual assault, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 940.225(3), a Class G felony.  Count 2 is dismissed but read in for the purpose of sentencing.
State's Motion for Testing of the Defendant for HIV Infection received and filed.
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce Expert Testimony and Expert RN Testimony at Trial received and filed.
State's Witness List received and filed.
State's Jury Instructions received and filed.
Letter from defense attorney requesting a plea be set for 07/29/2014 at 08:15am received and filed.  District Attorney's office and the Court approve this date.

Received from the State:  List of Witnesses; Proposed Jury Instructions
Received from the defense:  Witness List; Motion in Limine
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for Miriam Falk for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Pecora states that there are discovery issues to be resolved and requests another final pretrial before the 8-20-2014 jury trial date.  Case set for 8-13-2014.

Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for final pretrial on 7-9-2013 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 8-20-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 5-30-2014.  Witness lists and all discovery to be completed by June 30.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING / ARRAIGNMENT (28 pages) commencing APRIL 18, 2014 received and filed.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Melissa M. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26196914 in court 1x on 4/18/14.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 4/18/14 for Melissa M. for 1 appearance on 4/18/14.

Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Paul Tiffin for Miriam S Falk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: citizen Melissa M.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:15 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
14RM019258  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-09-2014

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MMM, her residence or place of employment.

Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Jesus R Ladwig in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for public defender representation.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
